company_name: Vietnam Technological And Commercial Joint Stock Bank
company_profile: Vietnam Technological And Commercial Joint Stock Bank (TCB) was established in 1993. The Bank has its business in mobilisation and trade of capital, and provision of relevant financial services. Techcombank has become a public company since 2007. In 2024, compared to the same period, The net interest margin (NIM) stood at 4.21%, reflecting an increase of 0.19%. The non-performing loan ratio was at 1.12%, decreasing of 0.03%. The coverage ratio for non-performing loans (NPL) was at 113.94%, increasing of 11.79%. the net profit after tax of the parent company is valued at VND21.5 trillion, increased 19.55%. The return on equity (ROE) was at 15.61%, up 0.77%. On June 4, 2018, TCB was officially listed and traded on the Ho Chi Minh City Stock Exchange (HOSE).
history_dev: 1993: Vietnam Technological and Commercial Joint Stock Bank ("Techcombank") was established with an initial charter capital of VND 20 billion; 1996: Increased the charter capital to VND70 billion; 2005: Increased the charter capital to VND555 billion; 2006: Raised the charter capital to VND1.500 billion; 2007: Became a public company, implemented internet banking system; 2008: Increased the charter capital to VND3,642,014,710,000; 2009: Rewarded in the list of Top 500 largest enterprises in Vietnam 2009 (VNR500); 2010: Increased the charter capital to VND6,932,183,710,000; 2011: Increased the charter capital to VND8,788,078,710,000; 2012: Increased the charter capital to VND8,848,078,710,000; 2013: Increased the charter capital to VND9,578,078,710,000; 2014: Launched mobile banking application F@st Mobile; 2015: Acquired and renamed Vietnam Chemical Finance Joint Stock Company as Techcom Finance Co.,Ltd (TechcomFinance); 2017: Charter capital was raised to VND11,655,307,200,000; Early 2018: Divested its capital from Techcom Finance Co., Ltd (TechcomFinance); May 22, 2018: Listed on Hochiminh Stock Exchange (HOSE); June 04, 2018: Traded on Hochiminh Stock Exchange (HOSE); August 10, 2018: Increased the charter capital to VND VND34,965,921,600,000; November 12, 2019: Increased the charter capital to VND VND35,001,399,620,000; January 19, 2021: Increased the charter capital to VND35,049,062,300,000; December 16, 2021: Increased the charter capital to VND35,109,147,980,000; October 21, 2022: Increased charter capital to VND 35,172,385,140,000; January 3, 2024: Increased charter capital to VND 35,225,108,110,000 ; January 22, 2025: Increased charter capital to VND70,648,517,390,000;
company_promise: Digital transformation in the financial and banking sector is considered a top priority by the Government of Vietnam. Developing digital banks and becoming a leading digital bank is the primary objective of many commercial banks today.
business_risk: The risk of inflation is posed by various objective and subjective factors, both domestically and internationally, including the impact of trade policies, tight monetary policies, and capital outflows from major economies. Expanding the credit scale excessively and an excessive pursuit of supportive policies through programs and preferential credit packages (both in terms of capital and interest rates) without proper identification, timely adjustments, and support from fiscal policies can have long-term implications on the stability of the financial system.
key_developments: Mobilizing capital; Granting credit; Financial investment and cooperation; Trading foreign currencies; Providing financial services: deposit, cards, guarantee, international payment, internet banking, consumer finance; Providing corporate consultation and asset management services;
business_strategies: Expanding the customer base in terms of scale and speed, through further strengthening the powerful digital experience within the "all-in-one" WINLife ecosystem. Enhancing risk management plays a crucial role. The goal is to expand the customer base beyond the existing four targeted economic sectors, focusing on the tourism and resort industry, the automotive industry, and large-scale foreign direct investment (FDI) enterprises.
